issue.title: Play store give me warning of Fixing a Zip Path Traversal Vulnerability In Android

repository.name: zip4j
repository.description: A Java library for zip files and streams

issue.body:
Hi Dear! Recently I used your code for unzipping file to app folder and app is published on play store, play store give me warring of "Fixing a Zip Path Traversal Vulnerability In Android"
https://support.google.com/faqs/answer/9294009

body:
Yes, I was able to reproduce this. There is [a check in zip4j][1] to avoid such issues, ~~but it currently only checks if the path is completely different than the extraction path. If it is a parent path, this check will go through. Will fix it.~~ (Read the comment below for the reason of this strikeout of part of this comment)

[1]: https://github.com/srikanth-lingala/zip4j/blob/master/src/main/java/net/lingala/zip4j/tasks/AbstractExtractFileTask.java#L42

I managed to find a simple fix for it. Issue is fixed. Will include it in the next release.

However, I would highly recommend you to read through the comment above to see if your circumstances were same to the circumstance I was able to reproduce the issue with.
https://github.com/snyk/zip-slip-vulnerability, I think the issue is resolved v1.3.3 according to zip-slip-vulnerability
@attaullahpro Yes, this was originally fixed as part of zip slip fix in v1.3.3. But there were a few more enhancements in the fix in v2.x.

issue.title: Path Traversal vulnerability: Security Alert Received on Google Play Console

body:
Srikanth- I tested the new version released and still see the path traversal vulnerability in there. The below file will give off the vulnerability.
[Archive(1).zip](https://github.com/srikanth-lingala/zip4j/files/4245494/Archive.1.zip)

issue.title: Problem extracting zip file: illegal file name that breaks out of the target directory: /

repository.name: zip4j
repository.description: A Java library for zip files and streams

issue.body:
Hi i have problem extracting a zip file which was generated by maven assembly plugin.
https://github.com/srikanth-lingala/zip4j/blob/ed9eed54de22cb845ded8d582b7330adcc7ba9af/src/main/java/net/lingala/zip4j/tasks/AbstractExtractFileTask.java#L53


I debuged into that place and found out that the outputfile does not have a trailing slash but the outputCannonical path variable has.
Thats what i see in the IDE

> outputFile = {File@1809} "D:\Users\XXXXXXX\AppData\Local\Temp\dependentrules14443115985707206885"
    outputCanonicalPath = "D:\Users\XXXXXXX\AppData\Local\Temp\dependentrules14443115985707206885\\"
 

The zip file header looks like this:

> versionMadeBy = 788
fileCommentLength = 0
diskNumberStart = 0
internalFileAttributes = {byte[2]@1817} [0, 0]
externalFileAttributes = {byte[4]@1818} [16, 0, -19, 65]
offsetLocalHeader = 5294
fileComment = null
versionNeededToExtract = 10
generalPurposeFlag = {byte[2]@1819} [0, 0]
compressionMethod = {CompressionMethod@1820} "STORE"
lastModifiedTime = 1412516727
crc = 0
compressedSize = 0
uncompressedSize = 0
fileNameLength = 1
extraFieldLength = 0
fileName = "/"
isEncrypted = false
encryptionMethod = {EncryptionMethod@1822} "NONE"
dataDescriptorExists = false
zip64ExtendedInfo = null
aesExtraDataRecord = null
fileNameUTF8Encoded = false
extraDataRecords = null
isDirectory = true
signature = {HeaderSignature@1823} "CENTRAL_DIRECTORY"


Any solution to this? Is this a bug? Anyone had the same problem?
